description: Reports when the address pool utilization has reached the configured
high utilization threshold. See the DESCRIPTIONs for the
juniDhcpLocalServerPoolTable elements for details on what conditions
trigger a high pool utilization notification.

event.Summary: Address pool utilization ($v4 %) reached high threshold

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerPoolHighAddrUtil Juniper-ROUTER-MIB::juniRouterName s EXAMPLE Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerPoolSize i 9999 Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerPoolInUse i 9999 Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerPoolUtilPct i 0

description: The administratively assigned name given to this router. The name must
be unique within the context of this table and cannot be changed after
the router instance is created.
variables.name: Juniper-ROUTER-MIB::juniRouterName

description: The number of addresses available in this pool.
variables.name: Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerPoolSize

description: The number of addresses currently allocated from this pool.
variables.name: Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerPoolInUse

description: The current address utilization for this pool. When all the addresses
in the pool are exhausted this object value becomes 100, i.e, poolUtil =
100%. When the pool reaches this stage, there won't be anymore
addresses available from the pool. Any attempt to allocate an address
from the pool will each time result in a
juniDhcpLocalServerPoolNoAddresses notification.
variables.name: Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerPoolUtilPct

description: Reports when the address pool utilization has fallen to the configured
abated threshold level. See the DESCRIPTIONs for the
juniDhcpLocalServerPoolTable elements for details on what conditions
trigger a abated pool utilization notification.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerPoolAbatedAddrUtil Juniper-ROUTER-MIB::juniRouterName s EXAMPLE Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerPoolSize i 9999 Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerPoolInUse i 9999 Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerPoolUtilPct i 0

description: The administratively assigned name given to this router. The name must
be unique within the context of this table and cannot be changed after
the router instance is created.
variables.name: Juniper-ROUTER-MIB::juniRouterName

description: The number of addresses available in this pool.
variables.name: Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerPoolSize

description: The number of addresses currently allocated from this pool.
variables.name: Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerPoolInUse

description: The current address utilization for this pool. When all the addresses
in the pool are exhausted this object value becomes 100, i.e, poolUtil =
100%. When the pool reaches this stage, there won't be anymore
addresses available from the pool. Any attempt to allocate an address
from the pool will each time result in a
juniDhcpLocalServerPoolNoAddresses notification.
variables.name: Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerPoolUtilPct

description: Reports when the address pool has exhausted its supply of addresses.
This trap is issued every time a request is made to allocate an address
from a fully utilized pool. See the DESCRIPTIONs for the
juniDhcpLocalServerPoolTable elements for details on what conditions
trigger a no address pool utilization notification.
The administratively assigned name given to this router. The name must
be unique within the context of this table and cannot be changed after
the router instance is created.
variables.name: Juniper-ROUTER-MIB::juniRouterName

description: The number of addresses available in this pool.
variables.name: Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerPoolSize

description: Reports when a health event occurs in the DhcpLocalServer application on the router
identified by juniRouterName.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerHealth Juniper-ROUTER-MIB::juniRouterName s EXAMPLE Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerEventSeverity i -1 Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerEventString s EXAMPLE

description: The administratively assigned name given to this router. The name must
be unique within the context of this table and cannot be changed after
the router instance is created.
variables.name: Juniper-ROUTER-MIB::juniRouterName

description: The syslog severity of this server health event
variables.name: Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerEventSeverity

description: The text of the event string associated with the server health event
variables.name: Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerEventString

description: Reports when the address pool group utilization has reached the
configured high utilization threshold. See the DESCRIPTIONs for the
juniDhcpLocalServerPoolTable elements for details on what conditions
trigger a high pool group utilization notification.

event.Summary: Address pool group utilization ($v4 %) reached high threshold

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerPoolGroupHighAddrUtil Juniper-ROUTER-MIB::juniRouterName s EXAMPLE Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerPoolGroupSize i 9999 Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerPoolGroupInUse i 9999 Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerPoolGroupUtilPct i 0

description: The administratively assigned name given to this router. The name must
be unique within the context of this table and cannot be changed after
the router instance is created.
variables.name: Juniper-ROUTER-MIB::juniRouterName

description: Total number of addresses in the pool group for utilization events.
variables.name: Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerPoolGroupSize

description: Total number of addresses in use for pool group for utilization
events.
variables.name: Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerPoolGroupInUse

description: Percentage of pool addresses in use for pool group for utilization
events.
variables.name: Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerPoolGroupUtilPct

description: Reports when the address pool group utilization has fallen to the
configured abated threshold level. See the DESCRIPTIONs for the
juniDhcpLocalServerPoolTable elements for details on what conditions
trigger a abated pool group utilization notification.

event.Summary: Address pool group utilization ($v4 %) is normal

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerPoolGroupAbatedAddrUtil Juniper-ROUTER-MIB::juniRouterName s EXAMPLE Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerPoolGroupSize i 9999 Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerPoolGroupInUse i 9999 Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerPoolGroupUtilPct i 0

description: The administratively assigned name given to this router. The name must
be unique within the context of this table and cannot be changed after
the router instance is created.
variables.name: Juniper-ROUTER-MIB::juniRouterName

description: Total number of addresses in the pool group for utilization events.
variables.name: Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerPoolGroupSize

description: Total number of addresses in use for pool group for utilization
events.
variables.name: Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerPoolGroupInUse

description: Percentage of pool addresses in use for pool group for utilization
events.
variables.name: Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerPoolGroupUtilPct

description: Reports when the address pool group has exhausted its supply of
addresses. This trap is issued every time a request is made to
allocate an address from a fully utilized pool. See the DESCRIPTIONs
for the juniDhcpLocalServerPoolTable elements for details on what
conditions trigger a no address pool group utilization notification.
The administratively assigned name given to this router. The name must
be unique within the context of this table and cannot be changed after
the router instance is created.
variables.name: Juniper-ROUTER-MIB::juniRouterName

description: Total number of addresses in the pool group for utilization events.
variables.name: Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerPoolGroupSize

description: Reports when a subinterface has exceeded the limit of clients
allowed on that subinterface.

event.Summary: Local server interface $v2 client limit exceeded

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerInterfaceLimitExceeded Juniper-ROUTER-MIB::juniRouterName s EXAMPLE Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerSubInterfaceName s EXAMPLE Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerSubInterfaceLimit i 9999

description: The administratively assigned name given to this router. The name must
be unique within the context of this table and cannot be changed after
the router instance is created.
variables.name: Juniper-ROUTER-MIB::juniRouterName

description: The string that identifies the subinterface for this entry.
variables.name: Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerSubInterfaceName

description: The number of clients allowed by the local server on this
subinterface.
variables.name: Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerSubInterfaceLimit

description: Reports when the number of clients on a subinterface has fallen
below the limit allowed on that subinterface.

event.Summary: Local server interface $v2 client limit abated

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerInterfaceLimitAbated Juniper-ROUTER-MIB::juniRouterName s EXAMPLE Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerSubInterfaceName s EXAMPLE Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerSubInterfaceLimit i 9999

description: The administratively assigned name given to this router. The name must
be unique within the context of this table and cannot be changed after
the router instance is created.
variables.name: Juniper-ROUTER-MIB::juniRouterName

description: The string that identifies the subinterface for this entry.
variables.name: Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerSubInterfaceName

description: The number of clients allowed by the local server on this
subinterface.
variables.name: Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerSubInterfaceLimit

description: Reports the first occurance of detection of a DHCP client that
changed interfaces.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerDuplicateClient Juniper-ROUTER-MIB::juniRouterName s EXAMPLE Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerMacAddress s EXAMPLE Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerInterfaceString s EXAMPLE Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerLastDetected s EXAMPLE

description: The administratively assigned name given to this router. The name must
be unique within the context of this table and cannot be changed after
the router instance is created.
variables.name: Juniper-ROUTER-MIB::juniRouterName

description: The MAC address of the client that changed interfaces.
variables.name: Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerMacAddress

description: The interface where the DHCP client was detected
variables.name: Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerInterfaceString

description: The time the duplicate client was last detected
variables.name: Juniper-DHCP-MIB::juniDhcpLocalServerLastDetected
